paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

individual_records.phenotype_details: symptomatic ATTRv‐PNP with moderate to severe clinical symptoms
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Symptomatic ATTRv‐PNP patients presented with moderate to severe clinical symptoms and abnormalities in sensory and motor function tests.

individual_records.phenotype_details: asymptomatic mutTTR-carrier with normal NCS results
individual_records.evidence_sentence: NCS revealed normal results of peroneal and tibial DMLs, CMAPs, and NCVs, as well as of sural SNAPs and NCVs in all asymptomatic mutTTR‐carriers.

functional_data.summary: The study utilized magnetization transfer ratio (MTR) imaging to assess nerve lesions in carriers.

variants.segregation_data: The Val30Met mutation was found in 14 out of 25 asymptomatic mutTTR‐carriers and in 15 out of 30 symptomatic ATTRv‐PNP patients.
variants.population_frequency: Val30Met was the most prevalent point mutation found in the cohort.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of early diagnosis and treatment in ATTRv amyloidosis.
key_quotes: Val30Met was the most prevalent point mutation found in 14 out of 25 asymptomatic mutTTR‐carriers (56%) and in 15 out of 30 patients with symptomatic ATTRv‐PNP (50%).
In symptomatic ATTRv‐PNP, PNP severity was further subclassified as either mild to moderate (NIS‐LL ≤ 44) or severe (NIS‐LL> 44).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the TTR gene was extracted successfully.
